sen.j: 朽木 昌綱（くつき まさつな）は、丹波国福知山藩の第8代藩主。
sen.e: Nobutsuna KUTSUKI was the eighth lord of Fukuchiyama domain in Tanba Province.
Nobutsuna KUTSUKI was the eighth lord of the Fukuchiyama Domain in Tanba Province.
Nobutsuna KUTSUKI was the eighth lord of the Fukuchiyama Domain in Tanba Province.
The ninth load of the Kutsuki family in Fukuchiyama domain.
The ninth head of the Kutsuki family in the Fukuchiyama Domain.
sen.cmt: load→headに修正、the Fukuchiyama Domainとしました。
sen.e: The ninth head of the Kutsuki family in the Fukuchiyama Domain.

sen.j: 寛延3年（1750年）1月27日、第6代藩主・朽木綱貞の長男として生まれる。
sen.e: Born on January 27, 1750 as the first son of Tsunasada KUTSUKI, the sixth lord of the domain.
Born on March 5, 1750 as the first son of Tsunasada KUTSUKI, the sixth lord of the domain.
sen.cmt: 旧暦→新暦に修正、the Domainとしました。
sen.e: Born on March 5, 1750 as the first son of Tsunasada KUTSUKI, the sixth lord of the domain.

sen.j: 天明7年（1787年）2月22日、第7代藩主の朽木舖綱が隠居したため、養子として家督を継いで第8代藩主となる。
sen.e: When Nobutsuna KUTSUKI, the seventh lord of domain, retired on February 22, 1787, he took over as head of the family as the adopted son and became the eighth lord of the domain.
When Nobutsuna KUTSUKI, the seventh lord of the Domain, retired on April 10, 1787, he took over as head of the family as the adopted son and became the eighth lord of the Domain.
sen.cmt: lord of the Domainとし、旧暦→新暦に修正
sen.e: When Nobutsuna KUTSUKI, the seventh lord of the Domain, retired on April 10, 1787, he took over as head of the family as the adopted son and became the eighth lord of the Domain.

sen.j: 古銭収集が趣味で、特にこのことから「古銭家の王者」と称された。
sen.e: He liked to collect ancient coins and thus was called as 'the king of the ancient coin family."
He liked to collect ancient coins and thus was called as 'the king of the ancient coin family.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの片方をシングルに修正
sen.e: He liked to collect ancient coins and thus was called as 'the king of the ancient coin family.'

sen.j: 著作も多く、『蘭学階梯』の序文や『泰西輿地図説』、『古今泉貨鑑』、『新撰銭譜撰』12巻、『良貨分量考』など、多くの貴重な著作を残した。
sen.e: He wrote a lot of great books including the preface of the "Rangaku Kaitei" (an introductory book of the Western science study by Masatsuna KUTSUKI), "Taisei yochi zusetsu" (a geography book by Masatsuna KUTSUKI), "Kokonsen kakagami" (a numismatic book on ancient and temporary coins by Masatsuna KUTSUKI), "Shin sensen husen" (a numismatic book by Masatsuka KUTSUKI) Vol. 12, and "Ryoka bunryoko" (a numismatic book on material of coins by Masatsuna KUTSUKI).

He wrote a lot of great books including the preface of the "Rangaku Kaitei" (an introductory book of the Western science study by Masatsuna KUTSUKI), "Taisei Yochi Zusetsu" (a geography book by Masatsuna KUTSUKI), "Kokonsen Kakagami" (a numismatic book on ancient and temporary coins by Masatsuna KUTSUKI), "Shin Sensen Fusen" (a numismatic book by Masatsuka KUTSUKI) Vol. 12, and "Ryoka Bunryoko" (a numismatic book on material of coins by Masatsuna KUTSUKI).
sen.cmt: 著作名の単語の頭文字を大文字に変更、husen→Fusenに修正
sen.e: He wrote a lot of great books including the preface of the "Rangaku Kaitei" (an introductory book of the Western science study by Masatsuna KUTSUKI), "Taisei Yochi Zusetsu" (a geography book by Masatsuna KUTSUKI), "Kokonsen Kakagami" (a numismatic book on ancient and temporary coins by Masatsuna KUTSUKI), "Shin Sensen Fusen" (a numismatic book by Masatsuka KUTSUKI) Vol. 12, and "Ryoka Bunryoko" (a numismatic book on material of coins by Masatsuna KUTSUKI).

sen.j: また、蘭学研究に熱心であった。
sen.e: He was very interested in the study of Western sciences.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was very interested in the study of Western sciences.
He was very interested in the study of Western sciences.

sen.j: 前野良沢に弟子入りし、大槻玄沢ら蘭学者やオランダ商館長（カピタン）と交遊を持った。
sen.e: He became the disciple of Ryotaku MAENO and had interactions with Dutch scholars such as Gentaku OTSUKI and the curator of Dutch trading house, the Kapitan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He became the disciple of Ryotaku MAENO and had interactions with Dutch scholars such as Gentaku OTSUKI and the curator of Dutch trading house, the Kapitan.
He became the disciple of Ryotaku MAENO and had interactions with Dutch scholars such as Gentaku OTSUKI and the curator of Dutch trading house, the Kapitan.

sen.j: また、義兄である松平治郷の茶道の弟子にもなるなど、文人として名を馳せた。
sen.e: Also he became the disciple of Harusato MATSUDAIRA, his brother-in-law, in the field of tea ceremony; he was known as a literatus.
Also he became the disciple of Harusato MATSUDAIRA, his brother-in-law, in the field of tea ceremony; he was known as a literatus.
Also he became the disciple of Harusato MATSUDAIRA, his brother-in-law, in the field of tea ceremony; he was known as a literatus.

sen.j: しかし、政治家としては二流だったといわれる。
sen.e: However, he is said to have been poor as a politician.
However, he is said to have been poor as a politician.
However, he is said to have been poor as a politician.

sen.j: 寛政12年（1800年）4月9日、家督を養子の朽木倫綱に譲って隠居する。
sen.e: He let his adopted son Tomotsuna KUTSUKI to take over as head of the family and retired on April 9, 1800.
He let his adopted son Tomotsuna KUTSUKI to take over as head of the family and retired on May 2, 1800.
He let his adopted son Tomotsuna KUTSUKI to take over as head of the family and retired on May 2, 1800.
Died on April 17, 1802.
He died on May 18, 1802.
sen.cmt: 文頭にHe追加、旧暦→新暦に修正
sen.e: He died on May 18, 1802.
Died at the age of 53.
Died at the age of 53.
Died at the age of 53.
